meanings.definition: To predict or foretell future events.
meanings.sent1: Grandma often prophesizes the weather by looking at the sky.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller prophesizes that a great change is coming.
meanings.sent3: The cat prophetically prophesizes a mouse invasion.
meanings.sent4: The ancient book prophesizes a hero who will save the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The old tree prophesizes a harsh winter with its early shedding of leaves.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction or forecast.
meanings.sent1: The farmer prophesizes a bountiful harvest this year.
meanings.sent2: The economist prophesizes a rise in the stock market next month.
meanings.sent3: The child playfully prophesizes that it will rain candy tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl prophesizes the arrival of a new leader in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball prophesizes a journey full of adventure and discovery.

meanings.definition: To speak or write with divine inspiration.
meanings.sent1: The poet prophesizes beautiful verses under the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The priest prophesizes words of comfort and hope to the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly prophesizes a world ruled by cats.
meanings.sent4: The artist prophesizes a masterpiece that will inspire generations.
meanings.sent5: The prophet prophesizes a time of peace and unity among all nations.
